intro: Critonia platychaeta, commonly known as the broad-lobed hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are broad and lobed, with a hairy texture, and its yellow flowers appear in late summer. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
